[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: TryFrom<&[u8]>] [Deserialization vulnerability] Can an attacker craft malformed byte arrays that bypass validation in the TryFrom implementation (lines 54-60), causing the underlying DealtSecretKey::try_from to accept invalid group elements that could compromise the PVSS reconstruction algorithm? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: TryFrom<&[u8]>] [Point validation bypass] Does the TryFrom implementation properly validate that deserialized G1Projective points lie on the BLS12-381 curve and are in the correct subgroup, or can an attacker inject invalid points that break the Lagrange interpolation in secret reconstruction? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Constant size assumption] The to_bytes() method (line 32-34) returns a fixed-size array - can this assumption be violated if DEALT_SK_NUM_BYTES is misconfigured, leading to truncation or buffer overflow in serialization contexts? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Canonicalization bypass] Does to_bytes() enforce canonical encoding of the group element, or can the same secret share be represented in multiple ways, enabling double-decryption attacks in the PVSS protocol? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: TryFrom<&[u8]>] [Length validation bypass] Can an attacker provide byte slices of incorrect length to TryFrom that pass through to DealtSecretKey::try_from without proper bounds checking, potentially causing panics or memory unsafety? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Vector allocation DoS] The ValidCryptoMaterial::to_bytes() wrapper (line 43-45) converts the fixed array to Vec - could repeated calls in verification contexts cause excessive memory allocations enabling DoS attacks? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Function: new()] [Small subgroup attack] Does the new() constructor (lines 28-30) validate that the dealt_sk parameter is not in a small subgroup of G1, which could allow an attacker to compromise the discrete log problem's hardness? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_secret_key_share.rs] [Struct: DealtSecretKeyShare] [Rogue key attack] Can a malicious dealer create DealtSecretKeyShare instances with specially crafted group elements that, when combined during threshold reconstruction, cancel out honest players' contributions?
